sub_title: IT Consultant with expertise in Optimisation, Design & Data Analytics, Cyber Security, Digital Forensics & Quantum Information | Computational Science Masters @ UvA
summary:
Abinash Satapathy is currently pursuing his Joint Master Degree (MSc) in Computational Science at the University of Amsterdam and Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. He has completed his Bachelor Degree (B. Tech.) in Computer Science & Engineering at VIT University, India. He is an active person in the field of Data Analytics, Cryptography, Quantum Computing and Optimisation methods.

His interests and works put into words: 

♠ He has a good hold of data interpretation and statistical analysis of structured data.
♠ He has basic knowledge of working of mainframe and has hands-on experience through remote session login.
♠ He has 5 years experience in Python, C/C++. 
♠ He has taken the lead of several small projects of various courses in the University. 

♠ Moreover, he got the prestigious badge from IBM which qualifies him to set up a mainframe and perform operations for basic purposes. He was in top 200 worldwide in the Part - 2 of "Master the Mainframe" competition. For that achievement, he got a cash award of $100.

awards.title: Special Achiever Award 2017 - 18
awards.description: This award is given to students who have won in International competitions (both academic and non-academic). I got this award for being in "Top 200 worldwide with 100% accuracy" in the "Master the Mainframe" competition. I even got prize money of $100.

projects.title: Remedial Coaching for Slow Learners
projects.description: This project was aimed to get reviews of students, teachers and work professionals on how slow learners find it difficult to keep up with the pace in this busy world. It also aimed to provide "Remedial Coaching" for these slow learners.

company.name: Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology, Delhi

profile_positions.company: Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology, Delhi
profile_positions.description:
Project using QISKIT library in Python. The goal was to build a module which takes a truth table as an input and produces a Quantum object, which holds the Quantum circuit in it. It basically builds up the oracle (black box) function. This would help in minimizing the length of long quantum programs. 

Also, another motive was to learn Particle physics with an insight to QED.
profile_positions.title: Quantum Computing Research Intern

company.name: Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India
profile_positions.description:
I donate certain amount of money to the families of martyred soldiers of our country. The portal through which I pay is https://www.bharatkeveer.gov.in It is managed by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India.
I donate on the 9th of every month. I feel honoured when I can donate certain amount to the brave families.
profile_positions.title: Fundraiser

company.name: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM)

profile_positions.company: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM)
profile_positions.description: Core committee member of the VIT chapter of SIAM. It has been a great experience till now. I have managed few events conducted by the chapter. This includes 2 workshops as well.
profile_positions.title: Core Committee member

volunteer_experiences.description: I donated one thousand rupees to the organisation. I told at home that I was going to donate 250 rupees. So my parents allowed. But secretly I took 750 rupees extra without anyone's notice. This is a memorable incident from class 7 at Bethany Convent School, Paradip.
It was an awesome experience. The day was too hot then. In the intense heat, me & some of my friends volunteered as valets for guests.

company.name: Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India

volunteer_experiences.description:
I donated one thousand rupees in the account of Late Constable Naresh Yadav who lost his life fighting against terrorists in Chhatisgarh, India. I donated through www.bharatkeveer.gov.in Every Indian should donate certain amount to the army for their selfless service protecting the motherland. I have taken a resolution to donate certain amount in the account of other martyred soldiers on the 9th of every month. And it is going well. 
#Jai_Hind
